abstract.p: Bear Atwood letter praises New Jersey Supreme Court for striking down law requiring parental notification for abortion (Aug 16 article)

block.p: Re ''Trenton Court Strikes Down Abortion Law'' (news article, Aug. 16): Bravo to the New Jersey Supreme Court for looking below the surface of the law requiring parental notification for abortion and recognizing the real dangers that young women would face.

While everyone agrees that families should be involved in a minor's decision about becoming a parent, forcing a young woman to tell her parents or to tell a judge that she is seeking an abortion would send many young women out of state or to back alleys. Tragically, it would mean some young women would become parents against their will.

Re ''Trenton Court Strikes Down Abortion Law'' (news article, Aug. 16): Bravo to the New Jersey Supreme Court for looking below the surface of the law requiring parental notification for abortion and recognizing the real dangers that young women would face.

While everyone agrees that families should be involved in a minor's decision about becoming a parent, forcing a young woman to tell her parents or to tell a judge that she is seeking an abortion would send many young women out of state or to back alleys. Tragically, it would mean some young women would become parents against their will.

It is time for the New Jersey Legislature to stop trying to limit access to abortion and start working with the family-planning community, women's groups and educators to reduce the need for abortion by reducing unintended pregnancies.
BEAR ATWOOD Fair Haven, N.J., Aug. 17, 2000
